oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Margaret Croft and friends at Morro Castle
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Margaret Croft (second from left) stands arm-in-arm with three friends: two soldiers and one young woman.

Morro Castle, built in 1589, originally served as a fortress to guard Havana Bay against raids. Morro Castle and La Punta Castle (situated across the Bay from Morro Castle) were both built by Italian military engineer Giovanni Battista Antonelli and could be linked using an iron chain to protect the harbor from enemies. During the Seven Years War, the British captured the fortress, but it was returned to Spain in 1763. In later years it housed political prisoners.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Castillo del Morro (Havana, Cuba); Fortification--Cuba; Bays--Cuba; Americans--Cuba--History
